title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" and involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. The President must report these determinations to congressional committees. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" mandates the President to certify determinations regarding foreign financial institutions facilitating significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days. The certifications must be submitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant based on regulations in section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. The text chunk "SEC. 3. DETERMINATION AND CERTIFICATION OF WHETHER CERTAIN FOREIGN PERSONS HAVE SUPPORTED COVERED PERSONS" is about determining and certifying if certain foreign persons have supported covered persons. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report this to congressional committees every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. A person described in this section is an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property or interests are blocked under specific Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction. The curr_chunk lists specific Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction, including blocking property and prohibiting exports to Syria. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting exports to Syria, including those targeting human rights abuses and senior officials of the Government of Syria. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders targeting human rights abuses, senior officials, and transactions with Syria and Iran. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders targeting transactions with and entry into the United States of foreign sanctions evaders with respect to Iran and Syria, blocking property and entry of certain persons related to grave human rights abuses by the governments of Iran and Syria, and blocking property of certain persons related to serious human rights abuses by the government of Iran. The curr_chunk specifies individuals or entities subject to sanctions related to serious human rights abuses by the government of Iran, including Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to sanctions for serious human rights abuses by the government of Iran, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines terms related to sanctions for human rights abuses by Iran, including "appropriate congressional committees," "foreign financial institution," and "foreign person." The curr_chunk defines terms related to sanctions for human rights abuses by Iran, including "foreign terrorist organization" and "Iranian financial institution." The curr_chunk defines terms related to sanctions for human rights abuses by Iran, including "foreign terrorist organization," "Iranian financial institution," and "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action." The curr_chunk defines the term "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" as the agreement made in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, including the US, regarding Iran's nuclear program. The curr_chunk discusses the definitions of "person" and "United States person" in relation to the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
